name: The Hopkins Phonology Framework
body:
### Welcome to the Hopkins Phonology Framework.
The Hopkins Phonology Framework provides a toolkit for building 
string-valued graphical models for modeling phonology and inferring underlying forms
of words. The framework is build on OpenFST and provides an implementation of several 
inference algorithms as well as pre-built models. We also release datasets
we adapted from exercises in phonology textbooks. 

### Code

###  Publications
* Ryan Cotterell, Nanyun Peng, and Jason Eisner. Modeling Word Forms Using Latent Underlying Morphs and Phonology. TACL. (to appear).
* Ryan Cotterell, Nanyun Peng, and Jason Eisner. Stochastic Contextual Edit Distance and Probabilistic FSTs. ACL Short. 2014. 


### Authors and Contributors
Ryan Cotterell (ryan.cotterell@jhu.edu)
